<a id="GLTFCamera"></a>

# GLTFCamera

**Inherits:** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Represents a glTF camera.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Represents a camera as defined by the base glTF spec.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Runtime file loading and saving](../tutorials/io/runtime_file_loading_and_saving.md)

- [glTF camera detailed specification](https://registry.khronos.org/glTF/specs/2.0/glTF-2.0.html#reference-camera)

- [glTF camera spec and example file](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Tutorials/blob/master/gltfTutorial/gltfTutorial_015_SimpleCameras.md)

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="GLTFCamera_property_depth_far"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **depth_far** = `4000.0` [ðŸ”—](#GLTFCamera_property_depth_far)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_depth_far**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_depth_far**\ (\ )

The distance to the far culling boundary for this camera relative to its local Z axis, in meters. This maps to glTF's ``zfar`` property.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="GLTFCamera_property_depth_near"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **depth_near** = `0.05` [ðŸ”—](#GLTFCamera_property_depth_near)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_depth_near**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_depth_near**\ (\ )

The distance to the near culling boundary for this camera relative to its local Z axis, in meters. This maps to glTF's ``znear`` property.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="GLTFCamera_property_fov"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **fov** = `1.3089969` [ðŸ”—](#GLTFCamera_property_fov)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_fov**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_fov**\ (\ )

The FOV of the camera. This class and glTF define the camera FOV in radians, while Redot uses degrees. This maps to glTF's ``yfov`` property. This value is only used for perspective cameras, when [perspective](GLTFCamera.md#GLTFCamera_property_perspective) is ``true``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="GLTFCamera_property_perspective"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **perspective** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#GLTFCamera_property_perspective)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_perspective**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **get_perspective**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the camera is in perspective mode. Otherwise, the camera is in orthographic/orthogonal mode. This maps to glTF's camera ``type`` property. See [Camera3D.projection](Camera3D.md#Camera3D_property_projection) and the glTF spec for more information.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="GLTFCamera_property_size_mag"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **size_mag** = `0.5` [ðŸ”—](#GLTFCamera_property_size_mag)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_size_mag**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_size_mag**\ (\ )

The size of the camera. This class and glTF define the camera size magnitude as a radius in meters, while Redot defines it as a diameter in meters. This maps to glTF's ``ymag`` property. This value is only used for orthographic/orthogonal cameras, when [perspective](GLTFCamera.md#GLTFCamera_property_perspective) is ``false``.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>
